Job description

Inside Sales

Location: CBD & Inner Suburbs > Melbourne

Worktype: Full Time
Salary: $60000 to $61000
Profession / Role: Technology + Communications > Sales Executive / Representative

Description

What's in it for you?

A fantastic opportunity for a motivated salesperson to join an IT business solution provider as an inside sales representative. You will be provided with unrivalled career development opportunities in order to create and drive your own success. If you have sales experience and are looking to turn your passion for IT into a career, this is the job for you.

What You Will Be Doing

You will be selling business software solutions over the phone and face to face to small to medium businesses. This role offers the opportunity for career progression into a more senior business development position or a field sales executive role in the future. You will be working towards KPIs in order to receive quarterly bonuses, with a generous base salary of $70k+ superannuation +uncapped commissions.

Who You Will Be Doing It For

You will be working for an industry leader in the software-as-a-solution-space based in Melbourne's inner suburbs. They are a workplace that pride themselves on their collaborative, teamwork-oriented company culture and open plan working spaces. They are looking for someone who is excited to build their career and progress within this rapidly expanding company.

What You Must Have To Apply For This Role
  • Have completed a bachelor's degree or higher education
  • An interest in information technology
  • Business to business sales experience


You Will Be Highly Regarded If You Also Have
  • Experience working for Government or Not For Profit Organisations


All you should do to apply for this exciting role is submit your resume to Sophie Tidemann via the "Apply Now" button below. Send your CV ASAP as I will be screening applicants from the moment this ad goes live. If, however you want to know more about this unique opportunity or similar sales roles, you can call me for a confidential chat on my direct dial 03 9283 9091.

Only successful applicants will be contacted

Advertising Sales Manager

Company Name News Corp Australia Company Location Geelong, VIC

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 54 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Who we are

We are news. We are sport. We are lifestyle. We are News Corp Australia.

The nation's most influential media organisation, News Corp Australia reaches an unduplicated audience of 16 million Australians every month. As well as our famous news and sports brands such as The Geelong Advertiser, The Australian, and The Herald and Weekly Times, we lead the way with number-one websites such as news.com.au, realestate.com and kidspot.com.au. We have the largest online news audience in the country, with a bigger digital footprint than Facebook.



What's the role?

We're seeking a digital savvy and established Advertising Sales Manager to join our Advertising Sales team at the Geelong Advertiser. You will manage a diverse SME customer base located across Geelong, Bellarine & Surf Coast areas. You will deliver innovative advertising solutions across both print and digital including display, search and social. Whether it be website, YouTube videos or social media posts, you know how to effectively reach any audience on any device. You will conduct true discovery meetings and develop a full-service tailored advertising strategy across both print and digital which is aligned to our customer's business goals and return on investment expectations. You will develop and present proposals to customers, maintain competitor awareness and market movements and effectively manage relationships with customers to increase sales revenue.



Who you are

You will have demonstrated B2B sales success by using your excellent problem solving capability to provide creative solutions to customer's problems. You will be an excellent communicator with strong interpersonal skills who can effectively engage with a variety of stakeholders. You collaborate and network in an effective manner and know how to positively influence people. Your digital knowledge is second to none and you have the ability to sell digital solutions. You proactively keep up to date with the latest trends across the ever-changing digital landscape.

You'll ideally have experience within media, agency or publisher environments however we're open to hearing from digitally savvy professionals from any industry. You thrive working in a high-energy, constantly changing environment where you know you'll get out what you put in. You'll also be highly organised with the ability to work solidly under pressure. You will also have your own valid license and vehicle.



What's next?

This is a permanent full-time opportunity based at our Geelong Advertiser office. Come and represent the strongest brands in media across the Geelong region. To apply or find out more about careers with us, see newscorpaustralia.com/careers.

Job description

Retail Banking Services (RBS) is seeking a Talent Acquisition Partner in Melbourne for a 12 month contract on a part-time 3 days per week basis.

About Your Team

The RBS Talent Acquisition team’s vision is "To be Australia’s market-leading talent acquisition team with a reputation for quality, productivity and value, and enhancing the Group’s talent and performance."

Talent Acquisition is responsible for the strategic and operational planning and execution of all recruitment activity within CBA. This role sits within the RBS Network Talent Acquisition Team. We support business leaders within the National Retail Branch Network to attract, select and hire the best talent to meet the Group’s current and future workforce needs.

What will you be doing?
  • Identifying and hiring the right talent to support the business strategy
  • Protecting and enhancing Group’s reputation, culture and brand
  • Building internal talent pools and enabling career mobility for our employees
  • Minimising the risks and costs associated with recruiting talent
  • Proactively seek out ways to reduce early turnover, anticipating needs and partnering with the business to achieve strong outcomes
  • You will collaborate closely across a large Talent Acquisition community to continuously improve our service offering and execution in all of these areas

What will help you succeed?
  • You are experienced in utilising assessment methodologies as a tool to supporting hiring decisions
  • Previous experience in high volume recruitment within a large complex organisation is preferable, but not essential

If this sounds like you - please apply today !

At CommBank, we’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce reflecting the customers, businesses and communities we serve. As a value’s driven organisation, we nurture and support our people; through focussing on skill and talent development, collaboration, flexibility and internal promotion. With service in mind at every touch point, we take accountability for the role we play in securing and enhancing the financial wellbeing of people, businesses and communities. At CommBank you can be you.

Quality Advice Assurance Manager

Company Name AustralianSuper Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 23 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

AustralianSuper is for all Australians and businesses; we invest members’ money to help create the best possible retirement outcome. More than 2.2 million members trust us to invest more than $140 billion on their behalf. Our size has given us the ability to leverage significant investment opportunities for long term performance and lower fees that are passed onto our members.

We put members first in everything we do and are committed to the recruitment, development and support of a diverse workforce that share our values of Energy, Integrity, Generosity of Spirit and Excellent Outcomes.

Here’s where you come in…

To support the growth of AustralianSuper we are seeking a Quality Advice Assurance Manager who will be responsible for assurance and monitoring activities associated with the quality of financial advice being delivered to our members. Reporting to the National Manager Advice Enablement, this role represents an outstanding opportunity to ensure advice is provided in accordance with compliance frameworks and practices which meet all legislative and regulatory obligations, professional standards and business rules.

In this role, you will conduct reviews for accredited licensees to gain assurance they are complying with their Financial Services Agreement, that their activities remain consistent and that key risks are identified and managed. You will conduct adviser review activities, such as file reviews, member interviews and observations, using agreed frameworks to ensure independent and consistent outcomes.

You will report your findings, identifying improvement opportunities and appropriate remediation activities if applicable. You will make recommendations to the leadership group in terms of training requirements, assisting with or facilitating sessions as required.

You’ll need

Key to your success in this role will be relevant industry qualifications, including a Diploma of Financial Planning, plus previous experience in financial planning compliance, governance and/or audit. You have a thorough understanding of how financial planning businesses are run, and how to apply best practice compliance principles. You make clear decisions which may involve difficult choices or considered risks.

You have experienced significant success in managing stakeholder relationships with a consultative and high engagement approach, and are thoroughly versed in advice and licensing; dealing directly with advisers and licensees. You are organised, methodical, have high emotional intelligence and crucially you are able to exercise your judgement based on your expert knowledge and experience.

If you would like the opportunity to work in a challenging, growing and rapidly evolving environment to deliver outstanding results that benefit members, please apply now! Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

Agencies please note: this vacancy is being managed directly by AustralianSuper’s Recruitment team. We will contact our preferred agency partners should we require additional support. Thank you.

Industry

  • Financial Services
  • Banking

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Accounting/Auditing
  • Quality Assurance
]
